title: Integration Studio—Microsoft Teams integration
content:
Microsoft Teams is a messaging app for your organization—a workspace for real-time collaboration and communication, meetings, file and app sharing! It's a central place to collaborate with everyone in your organization. SMAX integrates with Microsoft Teams in several ways. By integrating Microsoft Teams with business apps like Service Management,you can break down silos between departments and increase cross-functional communication and collaboration. For example, integrating Microsoft Teams with SMAX can help ensure that everyone is on the same page and up-to-date on their requests and ongoing IT activities. You can automate notifications and alerts for specific events or changes in Service Management. This can help ensure that everyone is notified of important updates in a timely manner and reduce the need for manual communication. This can help reduce miscommunication and misunderstandings and ensure that everyone is working towards the same goals. While you have many choices for how to integrate with Teams, let's highlight some options supported by Service Management.

Bot-based interactions

A bot provides the most comprehensive solution to facilitate this integration. A bot in Teams offers users a friendly and intuitive way to ask for help, from answering simple questions, drawing on your existing knowledge base, to providing resolution instructions, and ultimately creating and assigning new service tickets for issues that the bot cannot resolve. On the other hand, a bot requires maintenance and configuration to ensure that all use cases are properly handled.

For details about how to set up the above use cases, see Set up Teams bot integration.

Notifications into private / group chats

Another option to improve collaboration is to leverage the Microsoft Graph API and Bot APIs in Integration Studio. This allows you to create private chats between agents and end users or to create group chats around a specific topic like a major incident and programmatically add the required persons to the chat. Several templates are available for those use cases.

You can start with the templates Teams- Send notification in channel or Teams - Send notification in group chat.

Push notifications into teams and channels

In some cases, it's good enough to just push some messages into teams and their channels to enable cross-team collaboration. This solution can be configured using the SMAX-embedded MS Teams logic and is easier to set up and maintain, but provides less flexibility and functionality.

For details about how to set up this use case, see Set up Teams channel notifications.
